intro: Psychotria rufipilis, commonly known as the red-haired psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, moist environments and is known for its ornamental value. Despite its beauty, it is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
